intro: Murdannia paniculata, commonly known as the panicled murdannia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Commelinaceae, which includes plants such as spiderworts and dragon blood trees. The plant is characterized by its erect, herbaceous stems and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stem. Murdannia paniculata is often found in moist, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and open woodlands.
